intro: Panopsis sulcata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and prefers well-draining soil. Its leaves are usually dark green with a waxy texture, and the flowers come in a variety of colors including purple, pink, and white. Panopsis sulcata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
